intro: Crotalaria magaliesbergensis, commonly known as the Magaliesberg crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod fruits. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a unique spurred structure at the base of the petals. It plays a role in soil nitrogen fixation, making it ecologically significant in its native environment.
